column2: What GPA do graduate students need to be eligible for graduation?
column3: Graduate students must have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher in order to be eligible for graduation.

column2: What is the minimum grade for earning graduate credit?
column3: A minimum of 30 graduate credits is required for all master's degrees. Many programs require substantially more than the minimum 30 credits. Individual program requirements are outlined in the program descriptions of this catalog.

column2: How many credits below B- lead to dismissal from the Graduate School?
column3: Students receiving grades below "B--" in 9 or more credits , including undergraduate courses taken while a graduate student, will be dismissed from the Graduate School.

column2: What happens if an accelerated master’s student earns below B- in a graduate course while in dual status?
column3: Students enrolled under the accelerated master's program receiving any grade below "B-­" in a graduate course while in dual status may be dismissed and have their admission to the Graduate School withdrawn.

column2: How many chances do master’s or Ed.S. students get to pass their final exam?
column3: Graduate students will have a maximum of two opportunities to successfully complete final examinations for the master’s or Ed.S. degree.

column2: How many chances do Ph.D. students get to pass qualifying or final exams?
column3: Students who pass a three-part Ph.D. qualifying exam will have a maximum of two chances to successfully complete qualifying or final exams.

column2: What must conditionally admitted graduate students do to remain in the Graduate School?
column3: Students admitted on a conditional basis must meet the conditions as stated in the letter of admission in order to remain in the Graduate School.

column2: Can programs set stricter academic standards than the Graduate School?
column3: Students may be dismissed if they accumulate fewer than 9 credits below the "B--" level, and/or fail to make adequate progress in other aspects of their graduate program.
column4: ["- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Academic Standards (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=Academic%20Standards%20Graduate%20credit%20is%20only%20granted%20for%20courses%20completed%20with%20a%20grade%20of%20B-%C2%AD%20or%20higher.)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Academic Standards (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=Academic%20Standards%20Each%20individual%20program%20may%20set%20and%20announce%20standards%20for%20coursework%2C%20examinations%2C%20and/or%20research%20achievement%20that%20are%20more%20rigorous%20than)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Policy and Procedure for Program Dismissals (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=Academic%20Standards%20-%20Policy%20and%20Procedure%20for%20Program%20Dismissals%20Graduate%20students%20shall%20conduct%20themselves%20in%20a%20manner%20consistent%20with%20the%20norms%20and%20practices)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Academic Standards (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=Academic%20Standards%20Graduate%20students%20MUST%20have%20a%20cumulative%20GPA%20of%203.0%20or%20higher%20in%20order%20to%20be%20eligible%20for%20graduation.)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Academic Standards (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/)"]

column2: What is the deadline to appeal a dismissal decision?
column3: The deadline for submitting a letter to the program chairperson and the dean of the Graduate School is ten (10) business days.
column4: ["- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Policy and Procedure for Program Dismissals - Appeals Process (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=Academic%20Standards%20-%20Policy%20and%20Procedure%20for%20Program%20Dismissals%20-%20Appeals%20Process%20To%20appeal%20a%20dismissal%20decision%2C%20a%20student%20must%20submit%20a%20letter%20and%20any)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Policy and Procedure for Program Dismissals - Appeals Process (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=Academic%20Standards%20-%20Policy%20and%20Procedure%20for%20Program%20Dismissals%20-%20Appeals%20Process%20Amended%20with%20approval%20by%20the%20Graduate%20Council%20November%203%20rd%20%2C%202017)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Policy and Procedure for Program Dismissals - Appeals Process (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=Academic%20Standards%20-%20Policy%20and%20Procedure%20for%20Program%20Dismissals%20-%20Appeals%20Process%20Program%20Level%20Appeal%20%E2%80%93%20The%20program%20chairperson%20will%20review%20the%20appeal%2C)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Policy and Procedure for Program Dismissals (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=Academic%20Standards%20-%20Policy%20and%20Procedure%20for%20Program%20Dismissals%20If%20the%20decision%20to%20dismiss%20stands%20after%20informal%20discussions%2C%20a%20student%20wishing%20to%20enter%20a)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Policy and Procedure for Program Dismissals (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/)"]

column2: Who recommends and who decides a dismissal for lack of academic progress?
column3: A department chairperson or a graduate program coordinator, upon the recommendation of the appropriate faculty committee, may recommend dismissal for a student who is failing to make required academic progress in their program. This recommendation shall be forwarded in writing to the associate dean of the Graduate School with a copy to the affected student.
column4: ["- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Policy and Procedure for Program Dismissals (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=Academic%20Standards%20-%20Policy%20and%20Procedure%20for%20Program%20Dismissals%20Dismissal%20for%20Failure%20to%20Make%20Required%20Academic%20Progress)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Policy and Procedure for Program Dismissals (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=Academic%20Standards%20-%20Policy%20and%20Procedure%20for%20Program%20Dismissals%20A%20student%20who%20wishes%20to%20challenge%20an%20academic%20dismissal%20as%20a%20result%20of%20failing%20to%20make)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Policy and Procedure for Program Dismissals (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=A%20department%20chairperson%20or%20a%20graduate%20program%20coordinator%2C%20upon%20the%20recommendation%20of%20the%20appropriate%20faculty%20committee%2C%20may%20recommend%20dismissal%20for%20a%20student)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Policy and Procedure for Program Dismissals (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=Academic%20Standards%20-%20Policy%20and%20Procedure%20for%20Program%20Dismissals%20A%20student%20who%20has%20been%20dismissed%20for%20failure%20to%20make%20required%20academic%20progress%20may%2C%20with%20the)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Policy and Procedure for Program Dismissals (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/)"]

column2: How many graduate credits are required for a master’s degree at UNH?
column3: A minimum of 30 graduate credits are required for all master's degrees.

column2: Can 700-level courses count for graduate credit?
column3: 700-level courses are advanced undergraduate courses.

column2: Is a capstone required for master’s programs?
column3: All master’s degrees at UNH must include a capstone experience, with the exception of capstone courses, must be approved by a committee of at least two faculty members in the student's program and approved by the graduate program coordinator. All capstone experiences must be completed by the end of the final examination period of the graduation date for which the degree is to be conferred.
column4: ["- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Master's Degree Requirements - Capstone Experience (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Degree%20Requirements%20-%20Master%27s%20Degree%20Requirements%20-%20Capstone%20Experience%20The%20most%20appropriate%20capstone%20experience%28s%29%20for%20each%20program%20is%20determined%20by%20the)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Master's Degree Requirements - Capstone Experience - Capstone - Non-thesis Option (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Degree%20Requirements%20-%20Master%27s%20Degree%20Requirements%20-%20Capstone%20Experience%20-%20Capstone%20-%20Non-thesis%20Option%20Requirements%20for%20non-%C2%ADthesis%20capstone%20experiences%20must)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Master's Degree Requirements - Capstone Experience - Capstone­ - Thesis Option (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Degree%20Requirements%20-%20Master%27s%20Degree%20Requirements%20-%20Capstone%20Experience%20-%20Capstone%C2%AD%20-%20Thesis%20Option%20Students%20who%20are%20in%20a%20thesis%20program%20are%20required%20to)", "- Credit Transfer - Credit Transfer - Internal to UNH (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/credit-transfer/#:~:text=Credit%20Transfer%20-%20Internal%20to%20UNH%20A%20maximum%20of%2012%20credits%20of%20UNH%20graduate%20level%20%28800-900%29%20courses%20completed%20by%20a%20non-degree%20student%20or%20taken%20as%20an%20accelerated)", "- Credit Transfer - Credit Transfer - Internal to UNH (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/credit-transfer/)"]

column2: What are the residency requirements for the Ph.D.?
column3: A minimum of three academic years of graduate study is required for the Ph.D. degree. Resident graduate work done at other universities may be counted toward the minimum requirement upon approval of the guidance committee and the Graduate School, but one full academic year must be in residence at the University of New Hampshire.
column4: ["- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Ph.D. Requirements - Residency (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Requirements%20-%20Residency%20A%20minimum%20of%20three%20academic%20years%20of%20graduate%20study%20is%20required%20for%20the%20Ph.D%20degree.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Ph.D. Candidacy - Qualifying Examination (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Degree%20Requirements%20-%20Ph.D.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Ph.D. Candidacy - Language/Research Proficiency (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=These%20requirements%20can%20be%20found%20in%20the%20individual%20program%20descriptions.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Ph.D. Candidacy - Language/Research Proficiency (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/)"]

column2: What is Doctoral Research (999) and when must Ph.D. students register for it?
column3: Doctoral Research (999) is 0 credits, it grants full-time student status.

column2: When is a Ph.D. student advanced to candidacy and what form is required?
column3: A Ph.D. student is advanced to candidacy for the degree by the dean of the Graduate School upon recommendation of the graduate program coordinator after the student has passed the qualifying examination, met the language or proficiency requirements as are deemed desirable by the student's program, declared a topic for dissertation research, and fully formed their doctoral dissertation committee.

column2: What does an AF grade mean?
column3: A "AF" grade, Administrative F, is assigned for failure to either drop or complete a course. An AF is considered the same as an "F."  Grades Graduate Grading - Grades IA Grades: "IA" indicates "incomplete" in thesis credit, doctoral research, or other continuing courses of more than one semester. The grade earned will replace the "FIA" once the work has been completed.
column4: ["- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=Graduate%20Grading%20-%20Grades%20AF%20Grades%3A%20An%20%22AF%22%20grade%2C%20Administrative%20F%2C%20is%20assigned%20for%20failure%20to%20either%20drop%20or%20complete%20a%20course.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=Graduate%20Grading%20-%20Grades%20Audit%20Grades%3A%20An%20%22AU%22%20grade%20is%20assigned%20for%20completion%20of%20courses%20for%20which%20an%20audit%20was%20granted.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=A%20%22CR%22%20grade%20is%20assigned%20for%20successful%20completion%2C%20while%20an%20%22F%22%20is%20assigned%20for%20failure.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=The%20grade%20earned%20will%20replace%20the%20%22IA%22%20once%20the%20work%20has%20been%20completed.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/)"]

column2: When is a CR grade used?
column3: A "CR" grade is assigned for successful completion, while an "F" is applied for failure.

column2: What does an AU grade mean?
column3: The grade earned will replace the "IA" once the work has been completed. In the case of doctoral research, once the dissertation is deemed complete, only the final term of enrollment will be assigned a "CR". Prior semester IA grades will remain on the official transcript.

column2: How does an Incomplete (IC) work for graduate courses?
column3: A "IA" grade is assigned with the approval of the instructor for excused unfinished work only.

column2: What is the policy on course withdrawal (W) and its impact?
column3: Students who withdraw, for compelling nonacademic reasons, submit an approved petition to drop a course during the withdrawal period, a notation of "W" will be shown on the student's academic record. The specific withdrawal deadlines can be found on the UNH Academic Calendar.

column2: How many times per year are graduate degrees conferred at UNH?
column3: Graduate degrees are conferred three times per year (September 1, December 31, and May) . The Graduate School allows UNH students to pursue two degrees at UNH and count credits toward both degrees under the circumstances detailed below. Such credit will be granted only for graded coursework completed with a grade of "B-" or higher.
column4: ["- Graduation - Graduation - Degree Conferral (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/graduation/#:~:text=Graduation%20-%20Degree%20Conferral%20Graduate%20degrees%20are%20conferred%20three%20times%20per%20year%20%28September%201%2C%20December%2031%2C%20and%20May%20%28date%20varies%29%20%29.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Degree%20Requirements%20-%20Dual%20Degrees%20The%20Graduate%20School%20allows%20UNH%20students%20to%20pursue%20two%20degrees%20at%20UNH%20and%20count%20credits%20toward%20both%20degrees%20under%20the)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Certificate Programs (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Degree%20Requirements%20-%20Certificate%20Programs%20Courses%20may%20be%20applied%20to%20only%20one%20certificate%20program%20but%20may%20also%20be%20applied%20to%20a%20master%E2%80%99s%20or%20doctoral%20degree)", "- Credit Transfer - Credit Transfer - Internal to UNH (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/credit-transfer/#:~:text=Credit%20Transfer%20-%20Internal%20to%20UNH%20A%20maximum%20of%2012%20credits%20of%20UNH%20graduate%20level%20%28800-900%29%20courses%20completed%20by%20a%20non-degree%20student%20or%20taken%20as%20an%20accelerated)", "- Credit Transfer - Credit Transfer - Internal to UNH (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/credit-transfer/)"]

column2: Do I have to file an intent to graduate?
column3: Students who do not file an intent-to-graduate will not have their degree awarded. Admission Admissions - Admission An official final transcript showing final grades and the awarding of the degree must be received by the Graduate School before the student may enroll for the graduate program.

column3: Graduate students must have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher in order to graduate.

column2: What is an IA grade?
column3: The grade earned will replace the grade earned once the work has been completed. In the case of doctoral research, once the dissertation is deemed complete, only the final term of enrollment will be assigned a "CR". Prior semester "IA" grades will remain on the official transcript.
column4: ["- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=The%20grade%20earned%20will%20replace%20the%20%22IA%22%20once%20the%20work%20has%20been%20completed.)", "- Integrated Applied Mathematics (IAM) - Integrated Applied Mathematics (IAM) - IAM 999 - Doctoral Research (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/course-descriptions/iam/#:~:text=Integrated%20Applied%20Mathematics%20%28IAM%29%20-%20IAM%20999%20-%20Doctoral%20Research%20Grade%20Mode%3A%20Graduate%20Credit/Fail%20grading)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=Graduate%20Grading%20-%20Grades%20Audit%20Grades%3A%20An%20%22AU%22%20grade%20is%20assigned%20for%20completion%20of%20courses%20for%20which%20an%20audit%20was%20granted.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=Graduate%20Grading%20-%20Grades%20AF%20Grades%3A%20An%20%22AF%22%20grade%2C%20Administrative%20F%2C%20is%20assigned%20for%20failure%20to%20either%20drop%20or%20complete%20a%20course.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/)"]

column2: Can I do a dual degree?
column3: The Graduate School allows UNH students to pursue two degrees at UNH and count credits toward both degrees under the circumstances detailed below. Such credit will be granted only for graded coursework completed with a grade of "B-" or higher. Application of such credit toward a student's program for a second degree is subject to departmental recommendation and approval by the Graduate School.
column4: ["- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Degree%20Requirements%20-%20Dual%20Degrees%20The%20Graduate%20School%20allows%20UNH%20students%20to%20pursue%20two%20degrees%20at%20UNH%20and%20count%20credits%20toward%20both%20degrees%20under%20the)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Degree%20Requirements%20-%20Dual%20Degrees%20All%20standard%20policies%20relating%20to%20time%20to%20degree%2C%20residency%20requirements%2C%20academic%20standards%2C%20and%20minimum%20GPA%20required%20to)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Degree%20Requirements%20-%20Dual%20Degrees%20Integrated%20Dual%20Degrees.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Degree%20Requirements%20-%20Dual%20Degrees%20If%20a%20student%27s%20tuition%20is%20funded%20by%20one%20or%20more%20units%2C%20it%20is%20up%20to%20the%20funding%20unit%20to%20decide%20if%20tuition%20may%20cover%20courses)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/)"]

column2: Can I appeal a dismissal?
column3: A student must submit a letter and any supporting documents to the program chairperson and the dean of the Graduate School within ten (10) business days of the dismissal notification. The application should provide specific evidence, context, or mitigating factors that the student believes should be considered in reviewing the decision.

column2: How do I reach degree candidacy?
column3: Ph.D. students at candidacy must register for Doctoral Research (999) each semester during the academic year until the degree is awarded.

column2: How long do I have to complete my master’s degree?
column3: The time limit for graduate work for any master's degree must normally be completed within four years from the date of matriculation (enrollment following admission) in the program.

column3: The Graduate Council has mandated that all incoming Ph.D. students complete RCR training approved by the Graduate School by the end of their first semester. For more information, visit the RCR website.

column2: What is a non-terminal degree?
column3: The degree of doctor of education is a terminal doctoral degree that prepares students for careers in educational leadership. The program curriculum comprises courses in educational policy, law, budget management, research methods, and human resources, as well as a research-based capstone. Requirements for completion of the Ed.D.

column2: How many thesis credits do I need to complete for my program?

column2: What is the Accelerated Master’s program?
column3: Accelerated Master’s programs offer qualified University of New Hampshire undergraduate students the opportunity to begin graduate coursework in select graduate programs while completing a bachelor’s degree.

column2: Can I defer my admission?
column3: Applicants who can't enroll in the term for which admission was offered may request to have their admission deferred for up to one year. Students who request a deferral, and who are not currently active in another degree program, are responsible for dropping any courses they may be currently enrolled in at the time they request the Deferral.

column2: Is there housing available?
column3: The University System of New Hampshire is the primary institution within the university system of new Hampshire responsible for providing graduate programs that meet state, regional, and national needs and the only one at which doctoral programs are offered. Other units of the University System do offer some master's degree programs.

column2: Does UNH offer student health insurance?
column3: The UNH Student Health Benefits Plan (SHBP) provides comprehensive, student-focused, primary medical care through a team approach. The clinical staff consists of board-certified physicians, nurse practitioners, nurses, and medical assistants who are committed to prevention and holistic care. Primary medical care is provided for a variety of common concerns.

column2: What is the difference between GRAD 800 and GRAD 900?
column3: The Continuing Enrollment Graduate School (GRAD) is for Master's students who are in residence and need to be full time but have already completed all course requirements, have previously registered for the maximum number of thesis or project credits. As this grants full-time status, students are also responsible for the full time mandatory fees.

column2: Where can I find information about assistantships?
column3: Students on full assistantships are involved in assistantship activities for 20 hours a week during the academic year. The workload for students on stipend only and hourly appointments is specified at the time of appointment. The load for students in both of these categories is less than 20 hours per week.

column2: How do I withdraw from the program?
column3: Students who are applying for readmission are required to pay an application fee plus, if readmitted, any accumulated continuing enrollment fees for the period during which they have been inactive. Students are not guaranteed readmission and may be evaluated in competition with current applicants to the program.
column4: ["- Registration - Registration - Non-registration - Withdrawal (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/registration/#:~:text=Registration%20-%20Non-registration%20-%20Withdrawal%20A%20student%20may%20request%20to%20fully%20withdraw%20from%20their%20graduate%20degree%20program%20during%20any%20semester%20by%20obtaining%20a)", "- Registration - Registration - Non-registration - Readmission (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/registration/#:~:text=Registration%20-%20Non-registration%20-%20Readmission%20Students%20who%20withdraw%2C%20who%20have%20their%20degree%20status%20discontinued%2C%20or%20whose%20time%20limit%20has%20expired%20and)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=Failure%20to%20officially%20withdraw%20will%20result%20in%20an%20AF%20grade%2C%20which%20is%20maintained%20on%20the%20official%20student%20record%20and%20included%20in%20the%20grade%20point%20average%20%28GPA%29.)", "- Registration - Registration - Non-registration - Leave of Absence (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/registration/#:~:text=The%20dean%20of%20the%20Graduate%20School%2C%20upon%20recommendation%20of%20the%20student%27s%20adviser%20and%20graduate%20program%20coordinator%2C%20will%20review%20the%20request.)", "- Registration - Registration - Non-registration - Leave of Absence (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/registration/)"]

column2: Can I change my degree?
column3: Students who wish to pursue a degree program other than the one for which admission was originally granted must complete the appropriate application for a change of degree. This includes students enrolled in UNH master's programs who intend to pursue the Ph.D. in the same department in which they were admitted for the master’s degree.

column2: How long does it typically take to complete the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: The M.S. in Biotech:IBMS is offered in traditional and accelerated formats each of which require students to complete 30 credits comprised of 4 Core Curriculum courses and a Graduate Biotech Seminar course (13 total credits), a series of Elective Courses (8-14 credits), and  Capstone experience (3-9 credits).

column2: How many total credits are required for the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.)?
column3: The M.S. in Biotech:IBMS is offered in traditional and accelerated formats each of which require students to complete 30 credits comprised of 4 Core Curriculum courses and a Graduate Biotech Seminar course (13 total credits), a series of Elective Courses (8-14 credits), and an Capstone experience (3-9 credits). Traditional full-time enrolled students will be able complete the degree in 18 months.

column2: What is the purpose of the Core Curriculum in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: The Core Curriculum in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program is based on market analysis and additional industry input to provide graduate-level skill competencies in the areas of protein biochemistry, molecular biology, and cell biology.

column2: Who helps Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) students develop a curriculum plan?
column3: Admissions Committee and their Faculty Advisor help Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) students develop a curriculum plan with the admissions committee and their faculty advisor. Each curriculum plan will be customized to meet the career goals of the student.

column2: How many total program credits are composed of core, elective, and capstone work in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: A minimum of 90 undergraduate credits must be completed prior to enrolling in graduate (800-level) courses. This coursework will count as dual-credit toward both the bachelor’s and master’s degrees.

column2: Can students begin the capstone before completing 9 credits in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: The capstone will consist of one of the following: Capstone A, a research project in a UNH Manchester faculty member’s research laboratory (typically your Faculty Advisor); Capstone B, an internship or applied research experience in an industry setting (including the student’s current workplace if applicable); or, Capstone C, an industry co-op experience.

column2: What is the minimum number of capstone credits in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: A minimum of 90 undergraduate credits must be completed prior to enrolling in graduate (800-level) courses, including Core Curriculum courses, Elective courses, Workshops, and the custom-designed Capstone experience.

column2: What is the maximum number of capstone credits in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: The capstone will consist of one of the following: Capstone A, a research project in a UNH Manchester faculty member’s research laboratory (typically your Faculty Advisor); Capstone B, an internship or applied research experience in an industry setting (including the student’s current workplace if applicable); or, Capstone C, an industry co-op experience.

column2: What does each credit in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program represent in academic work?
column3: Graduate certificate program students: Earn up to 8* graduate (800-level) course credits while completing a bachelor's degree. This coursework will count as dual-credit toward both the bachelor’s and master’s degrees.

column2: What is the main academic focus of the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) - A student successfully completing the biotechnology:Industrial and BioMEDical Sciences program will be able to: Compete effectively for Masters-level employment and for admission to Ph.D. or other graduate programs in their chosen area and be successful in these endeavors.

column2: Does the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program integrate academic and professional preparation?
column3: A student successfully completing the Biotechnology:Industrial and Biomedical Sciences program will be able to: Form a core expertise in an area (or areas) of biotechnology (and allied fields) selected by the student, sufficient to conduct supervised research or other further work (such as industrial development) in that area.

column2: What is the relationship between core courses and elective courses in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: The program welcomes students to enroll in courses in other UNH colleges to complete their elective requirements. In some cases (and with the recommendation of the Faculty Advisor and approval of the Graduate Program Coordinator), courses not on the approved electives list may be incorporated into the curriculum plan to provide breath of training.

column2: What is the overall purpose of the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) Accelerated Master’s Option?
column3: The Accelerated Master’s Option is a program for undergraduate students to complete the bachelor’s degree, and then officially matriculate into the master’s or graduate certificate program to finish the remaining required graduate-level coursework.

column2: What core knowledge areas will students master in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: The Biotechnology:Industrial and Biomedical Sciences program will be able to: Form a core expertise in an area (or areas) of biotechnology (and allied fields) selected by the student, sufficient to conduct supervised research or other further work (such as industrial development) in that area.

column2: What legal and regulatory understanding is expected in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) focuses on the application of the biological and biochemical sciences, and particularly genetics, to the preparation of new and enhanced biomedical, industrial, agricultural, and environmental products.

column2: What capstone expectation exists in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: The capstone will consist of one of the following: Capstone A, a research project in a UNH Manchester faculty member’s research laboratory (typically your Faculty Advisor); Capstone B, an internship or applied research experience in an industry setting (including the student’s current workplace if applicable); or, Capstone C, an industry co-op experience.

column2: In the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program, how many hours of academic work does each credit typically represent?
column3: The M.S. in Biotech:IBMS is offered in traditional and accelerated formats, each of which require students to complete 30 credits comprised of 4 Core Curriculum courses and a Graduate Biotech Seminar course (13 total credits), a series of Elective Courses (8-14 credits), and Capstone experience (3-9 credits). Traditional full-time enrolled students will be able to complete the degree in 18 months.

column2: What kind of theoretical knowledge is paired with practice in the Cybersecurity Engineering (M.S.)?
column3: Designed for working professionals and those with a strong interest in cybersecurity, the program combines in-class and online learning on how to develop, engineer and operate secure information systems. You will learn the theoretical underpinnings of information security and have opportunities to apply your knowledge and skills to real-world scenarios and authentic project experiences.

column2: How does the Cybersecurity Engineering (M.S.) position graduates for organizational impact?
column3: The Cybersecurity Engineering program is able to identify, analyze and respond to the complex information security threats that are increasingly common in today's digital landscape. You'll learn skills in core and advanced information security, preparing you to develop, integrate and evaluate secure IT systems and services for any organization.

column2: What kinds of students does the IT (M.S.) program welcome?
column3: The MS in Information Technology program is a professional graduate program in the applied and fast-changing field of Information Technology.

column2: When are classes offered for the Information Technology (M.S.) program?
column3: The MS in Information Technology program is offered year around in fall, spring, and summer terms. Classes are scheduled during the day and in the evening to meet the needs of both full-time and part-time students. If enrolled part- time and taking, on average, two courses per term, students can complete their graduate program of study in two years.

column2: How many thesis credits are required in the Information Technology (M.S.) Thesis Option?
column3: Students are not eligible to receive credit for any more than the maximum number of thesis credits required by the degree and are expected to monitor their registration to ensure that they do not exceed the maximum. No thesis credit shall be given until the completed thesis has been approved by the thesis committee and accepted by the Graduate School.

column2: Does the Information Technology (M.S.) offer flexibility for part-time students?
column3: The MS in Information Technology program is a professional graduate program in the applied and fast-changing field of Information Technology. The program prepares students for a career and for advanced studies in a computing discipline. Offered at the University's urban campus in Manchester, a city that embraces cultural diversity, the program welcomes students from all over the word.

column2: Can I take 900-level courses as an Accelerated Master’s student for dual credit?
column3: The Accelerated Master's Program is a program that offers 900-level courses for students who are completing a bachelor’s degree. This course will count as dual-credit toward both the bachelor's and master's degrees.
column4: ["- Admissions - Admissions - Accelerated Master's Program (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/admissions/#:~:text=Admissions%20-%20Accelerated%20Master%27s%20Program%20Accelerated%20Master%27s%20800-level%20credit%20forms%20must%20be%20completed%20and%20approved%20by%20the%20undergraduate%20advisor%20and%20program)", "- History (M.A.) - History (M.A.) - Accelerated Master's Overview - Accelerated Master's Highlights (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/programs-study/history/history-ma/#:~:text=History%20%28M.A.%29%20-%20Accelerated%20Master%27s%20Overview%20-%20Accelerated%20Master%27s%20Highlights%20Graduate%20certificate%20program%20students%3A%20Earn%20up%20to%208%2A%20graduate%20%28800-level%29)", "- History (M.A.) - History (M.A.) - Accelerated Master's Overview - Accelerated Master's Highlights (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/programs-study/history/history-ma/#:~:text=History%20%28M.A.%29%20-%20Accelerated%20Master%27s%20Overview%20-%20Accelerated%20Master%27s%20Highlights%20Master%E2%80%99s%20degree%20program%20students%3A%20Earn%20up%20to%2012%2A%20graduate%20%28800-level%29%20course)", "- Finance (M.S.) - Finance (M.S.) - Accelerated Master's Overview - Accelerated Master's Highlights (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/programs-study/accounting-finance/finance-ms/#:~:text=Finance%20%28M.S.%29%20-%20Accelerated%20Master%27s%20Overview%20-%20Accelerated%20Master%27s%20Highlights%20Graduate%20certificate%20program%20students%3A%20Earn%20up%20to%208%2A%20graduate%20%28800-level%29)", "- Finance (M.S.) - Finance (M.S.) - Accelerated Master's Overview - Accelerated Master's Highlights (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/programs-study/accounting-finance/finance-ms/)"]

column2: How many credits can I take for dual credit in the Accelerated Master’s program?
column3: Graduate certificate program students: Earn up to 8* graduate (800-level) course credits while completing a bachelor's degree. This coursework will count as dual-credit toward both the bachelor’s and master’s degrees.

column2: What is the minimum grade I must earn in dual-credit courses for the Accelerated Master’s?
column3: The minimum grade I must earn in dual-credit courses for the Accelerated Master’s is 8* graduate (800-level) course credits while completing a bachelor’s degree.

column2: Do I need to be admitted to the Accelerated Master’s program to take 800-level courses for dual credit?
column3: The Accelerated Master's Program Admissions Program is a program that provides undergraduate advisors and program coordinators with the ability to register for a maximum of 12 credits of 800­-level courses prior to completing their bachelor's degree.

column2: Do all programs at UNH offer an Accelerated Master’s option?
column3: Accelerated Master’s programs offer qualified University of New Hampshire undergraduate students the opportunity to begin graduate coursework in select graduate programs while completing a bachelor’s degree.

column2: What’s the difference between IA and IC grades for graduate students?
column3: The grade earned will replace the "IA" once the work has been completed. In the case of doctoral research, once the dissertation is deemed complete, only the final term of enrollment will be assigned a "CR". Prior semester IA grades will remain on the official transcript.
column4: ["- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=Graduate%20Grading%20-%20Grades%20IA%20Grades%3A%20%22IA%22%20indicates%20%22incomplete%22%20in%20thesis%20credit%2C%20doctoral%20research%2C%20or%20other%20continuing%20courses%20of%20more%20than%20one%20semester.)", "- Integrated Applied Mathematics (IAM) - Integrated Applied Mathematics (IAM) - IAM 999 - Doctoral Research (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/course-descriptions/iam/#:~:text=Integrated%20Applied%20Mathematics%20%28IAM%29%20-%20IAM%20999%20-%20Doctoral%20Research%20Grade%20Mode%3A%20Graduate%20Credit/Fail%20grading)", "- Integrated Applied Mathematics (IAM) - Integrated Applied Mathematics (IAM) - Degrees Offered: Ph.D. (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/programs-study/integrated-applied-mathematics/#:~:text=Graduate%20students%20are%20admitted%20to%20the%20IAM%20program%20with%20a%20variety%20of%20backgrounds.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=Graduate%20Grading%20-%20Grades%20Letter%20grades%3A%20The%20following%20grades%20are%20used%20at%20the%20University%3A%20A%20%284.0%29%2C%20A-%C2%AD%20%283.67%29%2C%20B%2B%20%283.33%29%2C%20B%20%283.0%29%2C%20B%C2%AD-%20%282.67%29%2C%20C%2B%20%282.33%29%2C%20C)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/)"]

column2: Can I appeal a course grade?
column3: A student must submit a letter and any supporting documents to the program chairperson and the dean of the Graduate School within ten (10) business days of the dismissal notification. The appeal should provide specific evidence, context, or mitigating factors that the student believes should be considered in reviewing the decision.
column4: ["- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=If%2C%20after%20consulting%20the%20instructor%2C%20a%20student%20still%20believes%20that%20he%20or%20she%20was%20treated%20unfairly%2C%20he%20or%20she%20has%20the%20right%20to%20seek%20redress%20from%20the%20chairperson)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Policy and Procedure for Program Dismissals - Appeals Process (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=Generally%2C%20dismissed%20students%20will%20not%20be%20able%20to%20continue%20in%20classes%20pending%20the%20outcome%20of%20the%20appeal%2C%20but%20the%20program%20chairperson%20may%20make%20a%20final%20decision)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Policy and Procedure for Program Dismissals - Appeals Process (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=Academic%20Standards%20-%20Policy%20and%20Procedure%20for%20Program%20Dismissals%20-%20Appeals%20Process%20Program%20Level%20Appeal%20%E2%80%93%20The%20program%20chairperson%20will%20review%20the%20appeal%2C)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=Graduate%20Grading%20-%20Grades%20Repeated%20courses%3A%20Repeating%20a%20course%20does%20not%20remove%20the%20original%20course%20or%20grade%20from%20the%20record.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/)"]

column2: What registration is required for graduate assistants to be considered full time?
column3: Students holding assistantship appointments are also considered full time and must register for a minimum of 6 credits, GRAD 900 Master's Continuing Research , or Doctoral Research (999).

column2: How many courses can I take during January Term (J-Term)?
column3: Students can register for only one course during January Term. For more information, visit https://unh.edu/januaryterm/.

column2: How is a master’s thesis committee formed at UNH?
column3: A master’s thesis committee is a committee composed of a regular member of the graduate faculty under whose direction it was written and two other members of the graduated faculty nominated by the department chairperson or graduate program coordinator and appointed by the dean of the Graduate School.
column4: ["- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Master's Thesis - Thesis Committee (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Degree%20Requirements%20-%20Master%27s%20Thesis%20-%20Thesis%20Committee%20A%20master%27s%20thesis%20must%20be%20approved%20by%20a%20committee%20composed%20of%20a%20regular%20member%20of%20the%20graduate%20faculty)", "- Computer Science (M.S.) - Computer Science (M.S.) - M.S. column3: The deadline to apply for Fall 2025 is August 18, 2025 - January 2, 2026.

column2: How do I apply for a graduate certificate?
column3: Graduate certificate programs are credit-based, taught by regular or associate members of the graduate faculty, and normally aligned with existing graduate education curricula.

column2: Can I defer my admission offer?
column3: Admissions are limited and competition for admission may vary from year to year. Applicants who are denied admission may have their applications reconsidered only if they furnish significant additional material that was not available at the time of the original decision.

column2: How many years do I have to finish my master’s?
column3: The time limit for graduate work for any master's degree must normally be completed within four years from the date of matriculation (enrollment following admission) in the program.
column4: ["- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Master's Time Limit (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Degree%20Requirements%20-%20Master%27s%20Time%20Limit%20All%20graduate%20work%20for%20any%20master%27s%20degree%20must%20normally%20be%20completed%20within%20four%20years%20from%20the%20date%20of%20matriculation)", "- History: Museum Studies (M.A.) - History: Museum Studies (M.A.) - Accelerated Master's Overview - Accelerated Master's Requirements (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/programs-study/history/history-museum-studies-ma/#:~:text=History%3A%20Museum%20Studies%20%28M.A.%29%20-%20Accelerated%20Master%27s%20Overview%20-%20Accelerated%20Master%27s%20Requirements%20Students%20may%20defer%20graduate%20matriculation%20for%20up%20to%20one%20year)", "- History (M.A.) - History (M.A.) - Accelerated Master's Overview - Accelerated Master's Requirements (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/programs-study/history/history-ma/#:~:text=History%20%28M.A.%29%20-%20Accelerated%20Master%27s%20Overview%20-%20Accelerated%20Master%27s%20Requirements%20Students%20may%20defer%20graduate%20matriculation%20for%20up%20to%20one%20year%20after%20earning)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Master's Degree Requirements - Residency (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Degree%20Requirements%20-%20Master%27s%20Degree%20Requirements%20-%20Residency%20A%20student%20will%20normally%20spend%20at%20least%20one%20calendar%20year%2C%20or%20the%20equivalent%2C%20in%20satisfying%20the)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Master's Degree Requirements - Residency (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/)"]

column2: How do I submit my thesis?
column3: The final approved dissertation must be submitted for publication by ProQuest via the UNH ETD Administrator website by the appropriate deadline as published in the Graduate School calendar. Physical hard bound copies are available for purchase through proQuest at the time of submission. Students in thesis programs may also be required to pass a final examination.
column4: ["- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Master's Thesis - Submission of Thesis (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Degree%20Requirements%20-%20Master%27s%20Thesis%20-%20Submission%20of%20Thesis%20The%20final%20approved%20thesis%20must%20be%20submitted%20for%20publication%20by%20ProQuest%20via%20the%20UNH%20ETD)", "- Applied Mathematics Ph.D. - Applied Mathematics Ph.D. - Dissertation (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/programs-study/integrated-applied-mathematics/applied-mathematics-phd/#:~:text=-%20Dissertation%20Students%20must%20submit%20a%20written%20thesis%20proposal%20and%20give%20a%20seminar%20presentation%20summarizing%20the%20proposal%20to%20a%20dissertation%20committee.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Master's Degree Requirements - Capstone Experience - Capstone­ - Thesis Option (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Degree%20Requirements%20-%20Master%27s%20Degree%20Requirements%20-%20Capstone%20Experience%20-%20Capstone%C2%AD%20-%20Thesis%20Option%20Students%20who%20are%20in%20a%20thesis%20program%20are%20required%20to)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Ph.D. Dissertation - Submission of Dissertation (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Students%20may%20choose%20to%20copyright%20their%20thesis%20at%20the%20time%20of%20publication.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Ph.D. Dissertation - Submission of Dissertation (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/)"]

column2: What are the mandatory fees for graduate assistants?
column3: Students holding full-time assistantships receive a fee waiver for the technology fee during the period of their appointment. Assistants, fellows or graduate part-­time lecturers must register for a minimum of 6 course/thesis credits, Master's Continuing Research ( GRAD 900 ) or Doctoral Research (999) during each semester in which they hold their appointments.
column4: ["- Fees and Financial Support - Fees and Financial Support - Graduate Appointments 2025-2026 (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/fees-financial-support/#:~:text=Fees%20and%20Financial%20Support%20-%20Graduate%20Appointments%202025-2026%20Mandatory%20Fees%3A%20Students%20holding%20full-time%20assistantships%20are%20charged%2050%25%20of%20the%20full-time)", "- Fees and Financial Support - Fees and Financial Support - Graduate Appointments 2025-2026 (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/fees-financial-support/#:~:text=Fees%20and%20Financial%20Support%20-%20Graduate%20Appointments%202025-2026%20Level%202%20-%20-%20%2424%2C010%20%28Doctoral%20students%20with%20a%20master%E2%80%99s%20degree%20or%20doctoral%20students%20with%20a)", "- Fees and Financial Support - Fees and Financial Support - Graduate Appointments 2025-2026 (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/fees-financial-support/#:~:text=Fees%20and%20Financial%20Support%20-%20Graduate%20Appointments%202025-2026%20Registration%3A%20All%20graduate%20students%20holding%20appointments%20must%20be%20enrolled%20as%20students%20in%20order%20to)", "- Fees and Financial Support - Fees and Financial Support - Graduate Appointments 2025-2026 (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/fees-financial-support/#:~:text=Fees%20and%20Financial%20Support%20-%20Graduate%20Appointments%202025-2026%20Level%201%20-%20%2422%2C890%20%28All%20masters%E2%80%99%20students%20and%20doctoral%20students%20with%20a%20bachelor%E2%80%99s%20degree%20who%20have)", "- Fees and Financial Support - Fees and Financial Support - Graduate Appointments 2025-2026 (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/fees-financial-support/)"]

column2: How much are graduate assistants paid?
column3: Graduate assistants are students who provide instructional or administrative support as specified by the appointing department and are normally supported by university funds.
column4: ["- Fees and Financial Support - Fees and Financial Support - Graduate Appointments 2025-2026 (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/fees-financial-support/#:~:text=Fees%20and%20Financial%20Support%20-%20Graduate%20Appointments%202025-2026%20Graduate%20Assistants%3A%20Graduate%20assistants%20are%20students%20who%20provide%20instructional%20or%20administrative)", "- Fees and Financial Support - Fees and Financial Support - Graduate Appointments 2025-2026 (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/fees-financial-support/#:~:text=Fees%20and%20Financial%20Support%20-%20Graduate%20Appointments%202025-2026%20Additional%20Stipend%20Information%20%3A%20Departments%20may%20pay%20a%20higher%20base%20stipend%20for%20assistants%20to%20meet)", "- Fees and Financial Support - Fees and Financial Support - Graduate Appointments 2025-2026 (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/fees-financial-support/#:~:text=Fees%20and%20Financial%20Support%20-%20Graduate%20Appointments%202025-2026%20Workload%3A%20Students%20on%20full%20assistantships%20are%20involved%20in%20assistantship%20activities%20for%2020%20hours%20a)", "- Fees and Financial Support - Fees and Financial Support - Graduate Appointments 2025-2026 (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/fees-financial-support/#:~:text=Fees%20and%20Financial%20Support%20-%20Graduate%20Appointments%202025-2026%20%2AAssistants%20who%20are%20appointed%20for%20the%20full%20academic%20year%20should%20check%20with%20their%20hiring%20unit%20to)", "- Fees and Financial Support - Fees and Financial Support - Graduate Appointments 2025-2026 (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/fees-financial-support/)"]

column2: How do I apply for financial aid or scholarships?
column3: Students who are full-time may be granted full­- or half-­tuition scholarships for the academic year or semester. These awards provide for waiver of tuition and are subject to the maintenance of a high scholastic record in the Graduate School. Application deadlines for admission and financial aid vary by program.
column4: ["- Fees and Financial Support - Fees and Financial Support - Scholarships and Fellowships - Financial Assistance (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/fees-financial-support/#:~:text=Fees%20and%20Financial%20Support%20-%20Scholarships%20and%20Fellowships%20-%20Financial%20Assistance%20Several%20forms%20of%20financial%20assistance%20are%20available%20to%20graduate%20students)", "- Fees and Financial Support - Fees and Financial Support - Scholarships and Fellowships - Scholarships for Full-­Time Students (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/fees-financial-support/#:~:text=Fees%20and%20Financial%20Support%20-%20Scholarships%20and%20Fellowships%20-%20Scholarships%20for%20Full-%C2%ADTime%20Students%20Students%20who%20are%20full%C2%AD-time%20may%20be%20granted%20full%C2%AD-%20or)", "- Molecular and Cellular Biotechnology (M.S.) - Molecular and Cellular Biotechnology (M.S.) (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/programs-study/molecular-cellular-biomedical-sciences/molecular-cellular-biotechnology-ms/#:~:text=Molecular%20and%20Cellular%20Biotechnology%20%28M.S.%29%20Please%20note%20that%20students%20admitted%20to%20this%20program%20are%20not%20eligible%20for%20departmental%20financial%20aid%20%28e.g.)", "- Admissions - Admissions - Applying for Admission - Application Deadlines (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/admissions/#:~:text=Admissions%20-%20Applying%20for%20Admission%20-%20Application%20Deadlines%20Application%20deadlines%20for%20admission%20and%20financial%20aid%20vary%20by%20program.)", "- Admissions - Admissions - Applying for Admission - Application Deadlines (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/admissions/)"]

column2: How do I withdraw from a graduate program?
column3: Students who are applying for readmission are required to pay an application fee plus, if readmitted, any accumulated continuing enrollment fees for the period during which they have been inactive. Students are not guaranteed readmission and may be evaluated in competition with current applicants to the program.
column4: ["- Registration - Registration - Non-registration - Withdrawal (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/registration/#:~:text=Registration%20-%20Non-registration%20-%20Withdrawal%20A%20student%20may%20request%20to%20fully%20withdraw%20from%20their%20graduate%20degree%20program%20during%20any%20semester%20by%20obtaining%20a)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=Graduate%20Grading%20-%20Grades%20W%20Grades%3A%20If%20a%20student%2C%20for%20compelling%20nonacademic%20reasons%2C%20submits%20an%20approved%20petition%20to%20drop%20a%20course%20during%20the%20withdrawal)", "- Registration - Registration - Non-registration - Readmission (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/registration/#:~:text=Registration%20-%20Non-registration%20-%20Readmission%20Students%20who%20withdraw%2C%20who%20have%20their%20degree%20status%20discontinued%2C%20or%20whose%20time%20limit%20has%20expired%20and)", "- Registration - Registration - Non-registration - Leave of Absence (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/registration/#:~:text=Registration%20-%20Non-registration%20-%20Leave%20of%20Absence%20Students%20who%2C%20because%20of%20extenuating%20circumstances%2C%20are%20unable%20to%20pursue%20their%20graduate%20program%20may%20request)", "- Registration - Registration - Non-registration - Leave of Absence (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/registration/)"]

column2: Can I take undergraduate courses as a grad student?
column3: A graduate student may petition to take undergraduate courses on a pass/fail basis. Such a petition must be approved by the end of the add period for the term the course is taken.
column4: ["- Graduate Courses - Graduate Courses - 800 and 900­ Level Courses (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/courses/#:~:text=Graduate%20Courses%20-%20800%20and%20900%C2%AD%20Level%20Courses%20800-%C2%AD%20and%20900%C2%AD-%20level%20courses%20are%20offered%20for%20graduate%20credit%20only%20and%20therefore%20are%20open%20only%20to%20admitted)", "- Graduate Courses - Graduate Courses (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/courses/#:~:text=Graduate%20Courses%20The%20faculty%20of%20each%20graduate%20program%20prescribes%20the%20courses%20that%20make%20up%20the%20degree%20program.)", "- Graduate School (GRAD) - Graduate School (GRAD) (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/course-descriptions/grad/#:~:text=Graduate%20School%20%28GRAD%29%20Read%20more%20about%20the%20courses%20within%20this%20subject%20prefix%20in%20the%20descriptions%20provided%20below.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=A%20graduate%20student%20may%20petition%20to%20take%20undergraduate%20courses%20on%20a%20pass/fail%20basis.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/)"]

column2: What is the time limit for a Ph.D.?
column3: The Ph.D. must be completed within eight years of matriculation (enrollment after admission) or within seven years if the student entered with a master's degree in the same field.
column4: ["- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Doctoral Time Limits (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Years%20on%20leave%20do%20not%20count%20toward%20the%20time%20limit.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Doctoral Time Limits (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Degree%20Requirements%20-%20Doctoral%20Time%20Limits%20The%20DNP%2C%20OTD%2C%20Ed.S.%2C%20and%20Ed.D%20degrees%20must%20be%20completed%20within%204%20years.)", "- Education (Ph.D.) - Education (Ph.D.) - Degree Requirements (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/programs-study/education/education-phd/#:~:text=Education%20%28Ph.D.%29%20-%20Degree%20Requirements%20Students%20typically%20complete%2052%20to%2064%20hours%20in%20graduate%20coursework%20following%20their%20matriculation.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Ph.D. Requirements - Residency (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Requirements%20-%20Residency%20A%20minimum%20of%20three%20academic%20years%20of%20graduate%20study%20is%20required%20for%20the%20Ph.D%20degree.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Ph.D. Requirements - Residency (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/)"]

column2: What is a non-terminal master’s degree?
column3: The University offers master's degree programs in a wide variety of disciplines, which can serve either as professional terminal degrees or as intermediate degrees for those intending to pursue further graduate study.

column3: Webcat allows students to file an intent-to-graduate through Webcat by the appropriate deadline specified on the UNH Academic Calendar .

column2: What is the process for appealing an academic dismissal?
column3: The program chairperson will review the appeal, solicit input from all other graduate faculty in the program, and re-evaluate the decision based on the additional information provided by the student and feedback from the program graduate faculty.
column4: ["- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Policy and Procedure for Program Dismissals (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=Academic%20Standards%20-%20Policy%20and%20Procedure%20for%20Program%20Dismissals%20If%20the%20decision%20to%20dismiss%20stands%20after%20informal%20discussions%2C%20a%20student%20wishing%20to%20enter%20a)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Policy and Procedure for Program Dismissals - Appeals Process (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=Academic%20Standards%20-%20Policy%20and%20Procedure%20for%20Program%20Dismissals%20-%20Appeals%20Process%20Amended%20with%20approval%20by%20the%20Graduate%20Council%20November%203%20rd%20%2C%202017)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Policy and Procedure for Program Dismissals - Appeals Process (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=Academic%20Standards%20-%20Policy%20and%20Procedure%20for%20Program%20Dismissals%20-%20Appeals%20Process%20To%20appeal%20a%20dismissal%20decision%2C%20a%20student%20must%20submit%20a%20letter%20and%20any)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Policy and Procedure for Program Dismissals - Appeals Process (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=Academic%20Standards%20-%20Policy%20and%20Procedure%20for%20Program%20Dismissals%20-%20Appeals%20Process%20Program%20Level%20Appeal%20%E2%80%93%20The%20program%20chairperson%20will%20review%20the%20appeal%2C)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Policy and Procedure for Program Dismissals - Appeals Process (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/)"]

column2: How many transfer credits can be applied to a graduate degree?
column3: Students may request that a maximum of two courses, for up to 8 credits of graduate level coursework, from an accredited institution authorized to grant graduate degrees, be transferred to count toward their graduate program.
column4: ["- Credit Transfer - Credit Transfer (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/credit-transfer/#:~:text=Credit%20Transfer%20A%20maximum%20of%2012%20credits%20taken%20by%20a%20student%20prior%20to%20matriculation%20%28internal%20and%20external%20combined%29%20can%20be%20applied%20to%20a%20degree%20program.)", "- Credit Transfer - Credit Transfer - External to UNH (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/credit-transfer/#:~:text=Students%20must%20submit%20an%20External%20Transfer%20Credit%20Form%20to%20request%20that%20the%20credits%20be%20applied%20to%20their%20degree%20requirements.)", "- Credit Transfer - Credit Transfer - Internal to UNH (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/credit-transfer/#:~:text=Credit%20Transfer%20-%20Internal%20to%20UNH%20A%20maximum%20of%2012%20credits%20of%20UNH%20graduate%20level%20%28800-900%29%20courses%20completed%20by%20a%20non-degree%20student%20or%20taken%20as%20an%20accelerated)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Master's Degree Requirements - Credits (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Degree%20Requirements%20-%20Master%27s%20Degree%20Requirements%20-%20Credits%20A%20minimum%20of%2030%20graduate%20credits%20is%20required%20for%20all%20master%27s%20degrees.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Master's Degree Requirements - Credits (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/)"]

column2: Can I take a leave of absence?
column3: Students who, because of extenuating circumstances, are unable to pursue their graduate program may request a leave of absence for a maximum of one calendar year. Such circumstances may include medical reasons, military obligation, family emergencies, or hardship.

column2: What is RCR training?
column3: To fulfill its obligations, the Graduate Council has mandated that all incoming Ph.D. students complete RCR training approved by the Graduate School by the end of their first semester.

column2: What is a guidance committee?
column3: The Guidance and Dissertation Committee is a guidance committee that assists in outlining the student's course of study and may specify individual coursework requirements. The guidance committee administers the qualifying examination.

column2: What is the minimum passing grade for graduate students?
column3: The minimum passing grade for graduate students is 3.0 (B) or higher. Students must earn a cumulative grade­-point average of 3.0, or higher, in order to graduate. Students admitted on a conditional or provisional basis must meet the conditions or provisions as stated in the letter of admission to remain in the Graduate School.

column2: Can I take a course Pass/Fail?
column3: Graduate courses cannot be taken pass/fail. A graduate student may petition to take undergraduate courses on a pass or fail basis. Such a petition must be approved by the end of the add period for the term the course is taken.

column2: Can I enroll in more than one degree?
column3: The Graduate School allows UNH students to pursue two degrees at UNH and count credits toward both degrees under the circumstances detailed below. Such credit will be granted only for graded coursework completed with a grade of "B-" or higher. Application of such credit toward a student's program for a second degree is subject to departmental recommendation and approval by the Graduate School.

column3: The Master of Science in Project Management (MSLM) is a practice-oriented program ideal for managers who want to enhance their ability to plan and lead complex projects, motivate people, and deliver the desired business value associated with the project.

column2: What is GRAD 800?
column3: The National Science Foundation Graduate Research Fellowship Program (GRFP) is a program designed to enable students to receive information, guidance, and support in applying for the National Science Fund (NSF). Students will become familiar with the NSF, its mission, and the selection criteria for this fellowship.

column2: What is GRAD 900?
column3: The National Science Foundation Graduate Research Fellowship Program (GRFP) is for Master's students who are in residence and need to be full time but have already completed all course requirements, have previously registered for the maximum number of thesis or project credits. As this grants full-time status, students are also responsible for the full time mandatory fees.

column2: How do I sibmity my committee?
column3: During the first semester, the student and advisor jointly select members of a guidance committee. A nomination form must be sent to the graduate school to officially appoint the committee membership. If a committee member rejects the submitted proposal, they must provide a response to the student, with copy to the advisor and other committee members.

column2: What is the difference between an IA and an IC grade?
column3: The grade earned will replace the grade earned once the work has been completed. In the case of doctoral research, once the dissertation is deemed complete, only the final term of enrollment will be assigned a "CR". Prior semester "IA" grades will remain on the official transcript.
